subject: Psychology
title: Attachment Styles in Adults
description: Learn Attachment Styles in Adults in one minute.

hook.text: Some people cling in relationships. Others push partners away. Your childhood may explain your adult love style.

buildup.text: Bowlby's attachment theory was extended to adult romance by Hazan and Shaver in 1987.

discovery.text: Three styles: secure (comfortable with closeness), anxious (fear of abandonment), avoidant (discomfort with intimacy).

twist.text: Attachment styles aren't destiny. They can shift through new relationships, therapy, and self-awareness.

climax.text: Understanding your style doesn't excuse behavior â€” it explains patterns so you can choose to change them.

punchline.text: How you loved as a child echoes in how you love as an adult.
